reviews.review_msg: Great TA.  He is able to provide difference contexts for the topics handled which makes it more interesting to see how these topics relate to other elements in our lives. He is also super approachable.  Would definitely take a class if he is teaching it.
Just a top notch guy! Always there for help when you need it and is always friendly and accommodating. The class would not have been the same without him.

Although I am doing pretty well, I would never take a class with her again. Marks critical essays hard, classes are hard to follow, fails to explain many concepts. Course reqs are not ideal. Way too many presentations, videos, activities in tutorials and not enough time dedicated to understanding material, readings etc. You really are on your own.

She comes off as bubbly and nice but she is very rude and condescending. Her tests are not difficult and straight forward if you memorize the lecture slides. She has very high expectations for papers. Lectures were bearable and content was repetitive.  Teaching is not her forte, she should stick to research. Stay far away.

Jason clearly cares about the content of the course but seems confused as to what a gender and geography course should include. 99% of readings were written by white females, and the course in general was very Eurocentric. He tries to be open to feedback, but his ego often gets in the way of him taking critical feedback seriously.

Expected way too much for a non-writing course. Doesn't give feedback or clear marking rubrics. Tries to let the students have a say in the assignments and midterm/final, however, entire class was just one note, no variation, extremely Eurocentric. Seemed more like social geography than geography and gender

The course was fascinating-you won't get good grades if you don't think deeply about the work. There are a lot of assignments but it also helped me become a better writer. Jason is passionate about teaching and his lectures are super interesting.
